dataModel.title: Vegetation Plots Database Component Description: treeStem
dataModel.author: J. Harris

entity.entitySummary: This table is intended to store information about indivdual tree stem data collected during a plot observation event.

attribute.attNotes: Primary Key for the stemData table.
attribute.attDefinition: Database generated identifier assigned to each unique stem observation.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table
attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table, thereby associating a taxon identification with the tree stem(s).
Name or code applied to a specific stem in the plot. This is generally a numeric label to associate a fielddata entry with a stem in the database.

The diameter of the stem in centimeters. When diameter classes are used the the stemDiameter is the midpoint between the low end and high end for the diameter class; the offset between this and the endpoints is stored in the stemDiameterAccuracy attribute.
The accuracy of the stem diameter measurements in centimeters. This represents the distance between the diameter class midpoint and endpoint.
The X-coordinate of the stem position. The user will enter the relative position of stems with respect to the plot origin (in meters) with the x-axis defined by the plot azimuth.
The Y-coordinate of the stem position, as above.

The measured height of the stem in meters. When height classes were used the stemHeight is the midpoint between the low end and high end for the height class; the offset between this and the endpointsis stored in the stemHeightAccuracy field.
The accuracy of the measured height of a stem, being the offset between the midpoint of the class and the endpoint, in meters.

attribute.attNotes: The default value is 1. This field is not logically necessary, but allows for more compact entry and storage of tree stem tally data.
attribute.attDefinition: The number of stems of a single species that have a common stem diameter and lack height and location data.
